newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso mixed on long bond, mkt awaits data.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso mixed on long bond, mkt awaits data.

text.p: The Mexican peso shed some initial gains and was mixed mid-morning on Thursday due to a zigzagging U.S. long bond, dealers said.

"The market has been see-sawing over changes in long bond yields, but dealing is thin as corporations are out of the market," a dealer said, suggesting big players were awaiting domestic inflation data expected later in the day.
The benchmark 48-hour peso was 0.2 of a centavo softer at 7.8300/7.8350 per dollar, while its 24-hour counterpart was 0.3 of a centavo firmer at 7.8230/7.8270.
Same-day peso contracts closed trade for the day 1.8 centavos firmer at 7.8200/7.8230 per dollar.
U.S. 30-year Treasury bonds reversed initial gains and were off 3/32 to yield 6.44 percent.
